intro: Pimpinella tragium var. nana, commonly known as dwarf cow parsley, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its compact size and delicate appearance, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
